overview:
Chris Vaughn is a Los Angeles native and tech entrepreneur. He is currently Head of Partnership Development at textPlus, as was most recently CEO & Founder of Jarvus.

He graduated Loyola Marymount University in 2010 with a degree in business management & human resources. While in college he founded Varmola, a web design and development company that built websites and online marketing packages for local clients. After college he accepted a position at Coupeez where he was Head of Product and Business Development. Coupeez was a deals platform aiming to bring the coupon/deals/promotions industry online, and he helped grow the platform to be the largest deals site in Ventura, CA (Coupeez’s test market), beating out Groupon and LivingSocial.

Chris left Coupeez to found Jarvus in 2011, a social tool that organized life around memories, moments and experiences. Jarvus let users collectively capture moments together using group albums, apply photo effects photo by photo, and mass upload these collections to Jarvus, Facebook, and Twitter.
